title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Panel-style interview for new grad nurse. Multiple nurse managers from different units there asking you questions. Not hard questions but it is nerve wracking being in front of that many people.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little about yourself

title: Clinical Application Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: It was a fairly straightforward HR phone interview. The recruiter was unable to answer the questions I asked of him, though. The interview felt rushed and like he was just checking a box on his end. He kept pressing why I wanted this position and said he felt I was overqualified.
Interview Questions: What is one thing you liked and one thing you disliked about your previous employer?

title: Healthcare Navigator Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions:
1st interview via phone call. The HR scheduled for 2nd interview which it was a hiring even. I was told to join it as my 2nd interview. 

The manager showed up with pencils and post-it notes. After explained the job and questions. Then she asked if I have my resume. I was like what? How did the manager go for my 2nd interview without my resume or she didn’t even know who was the candidate. At the end of conversation and questions, the manager asked me my resume or email my resume to her assistant. (That how I found out that I had been going the hiring event not my 2nd interview). 

I was super disappointed about their lack of management. I’m currently employed.  So, I didn’t really expect to join any hiring event if the HR told me as the beginning. I felt it was a waste of time that I had been through.  
 
Job was simple. Basically, you will have to get medical assistance certificate to assist people applied for affordable care or insurance plan that patient eligible for. Benefits sound right. But it doesn’t matter for me, because I don’t apply for benefits if not I had accepted John Hopkins’ offer already. I applied BayCare because it’s close to my house. 

Anyway, they’re not professional in my opinion.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about yourself?

title: Student Nurse Apprentice Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Bartow, FL) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: 1st phone call by HR, asked basic questions and moved me on to a video call interview with a manager Video call is scheduled for later this afternoon so I will update later.
Interview Questions: What was a difficult situation that you handled and learned from? Education, location, experience, and pay were discussed

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: Very comforting and casual conversation while still remaining professional. Worked around my busy schedule to choose an appropriate interview time. First interview was conducted via phone call. Second interview to be conducted via google meet.
Interview Questions: What are my goals and how can I ensure patient safety and satisfaction?

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: After selecting preferred dates for an interview, I asked the hiring manager what the salary range was for the role. The manager's response was they moved forward with another candidate.
Interview Questions: Select from a list of days/times for you to interview.

title: Urgent Care Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Clearwater, FL) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Extensive interview process. Be prepared to take drug screen, have your blood drawn and a long a wait time while doing this. Phone interview, in person interview, then an appointment to get the screening done and your photo taken for the badge.
Interview Questions: Positive interview to see how I would react if someone was upset or in need of immediate health care.

title: Medical Office Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: The interview process started with an interview with an HR representative. Afterward there was a second interview. The second interview at the time was over Microsoft Teams. When it was over, I was notified later on by email.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in BayCare?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was smooth and thorough. I felt comfortable speaking with the interviewers and they were very patient with allowing me to answer questions. They answered any questions I had thoroughly and called me back within a few days.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you were presented with an ethically challenging situation and how did you handle it?

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Lakeland, FL) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: They called me for an interview just to tell me the position was already filled. Honestly was a complete waste of time. Also, their starting pay is low compared to Adventhealth
Interview Questions: What made you consider this position

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BayCare Health System in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied online very easily and received an email the next to schedule an appointment time. The time options were very flexible. After I chose my time, I received my confirmation. Then the interviewer called at the exact time had scheduled and asked me questions over the phone.
Interview Questions: Mostly questions about my experience

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: Met with recruiter then told I’d meet with the hiring manager! Waiting to meet with them in October! I’m hoping I get the position. The recruiter was very nice and easy to talk with.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a PCT?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: Very welcoming and nice. the interviewer was kind and understanding. there was no need to be anxious about the interview. she answered all of my questions. she provided all the information i asked for and more.
Interview Questions: what are some of your biggest strengths?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: Virtual interview over Microsoft Teams using audio and visual. Was very professional and interviewer asked great questions. It was a very relaxed and comfortable environment. Very grateful for the opportunity.
Interview Questions: Can you please describe a time that you made a mistake and how you handled it?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Face to face interview with the hiring manager and one team member. They asked typical situational questions. We reviewed my accounting and computer related skills and reviewed my resume. The interview lasted about 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you had multiple assignments due at the same time, how did you handle this?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter emails applicants to schedule a phone interview and never actually calls number provided when meeting is scheduled. So the interview never even occurs. There is also no follow up to their interview process especially if it’s done on places like indeed.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Office Staff Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: Very cordial. Formal. Straight forward as to what they were looking for. They explained the doctor:patient ratio. The benefits of keeping the doctor on time and task. Also a tour of the office.
Interview Questions: How are your triaging skills?

title: Nurse Graduate (RN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Saint Pete, FL) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: The only interview I had was with a recruiter. They have you do a bunch of stuff before you even interview with the managers there so it was basically a whole waste of my time. They offer specific units and only allow new grads in certain specialty units if they know them/currently work for the company. I understand that, but telling me that a new grad can work in the ER but that they aren't fit to work in psych is honestly wild. They offered me a few different units to interview with and asked me to provide my license info after I passed my NCLEX. I did that, and never heard back. I then emailed them again to see how the process was going, again no response. I emailed them a third time asking if I could at least get confirmation that they weren't going to proceed with having me interview with a manager and again, nothing. They were extremely unprofessional and did not respect my time. While yes, Baycare is a great company, I feel as though they have this complex where just because they're Baycare they can do whatever they want. The recruiter got my hopes up saying I would initially hear back after a few days to interview but nothing happened and that's when I proceeded to be ghosted 3 times.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work here? 
What experience do you have in a hospital setting?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview with recruiter, then came in person to meet with manager and few other members of the team. It was mostly laid back, with the interviewers just trying to understand my experience, my skills, and if I would be a good fit.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in healthcare?

title: Food Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: They're picky on who they choose; no matter what position you try to get. Every advice or practice they will just be picky about you. They'll get your hopes up and destroy it.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join Baycare?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: I was first asked contacted by a member from the recruitment group. She asked me a series of questions to see if I had the qualification. After completing that, I was asked to submit three references. After submitting three references I was told I will be contacted by the manager of the unit. Overall, very easy to follow and clear interview process.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in May 2022

title: Registered Nurse Interview

Interview Descriptions: Application online, Email with link to schedule interview. Phone interview with recruiter, in person interview with manager at the hospital. Reference check request after phone interview.              REquired words listed here because it won’t save. There is nothing else to list here about the interview process.

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview

Interview Descriptions: In a panel of 6-9 managers and they all ask you questions, one at a time. Whichever ones like you, then they'll offer you a job. You'll know a couple days later.

title: Social Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: The HR/talent acquisition is a joke at this company.  They are the gatekeepers to get through but they constantly drop the ball.  In phone interviews it is abundantly apparent they aren't even listening and have not even taken the time to do a periphery scan of a resume.  One I spoke to in an advanced position wasn't even sure the position I was applying for fell under the jobs that they fill.
Interview Questions: What is your highest level of education?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: Go through screening process with recruiter and if they think that you are a good fit then they set you up with in person interviews. After that, your recruiter will tell you if you got it or not. Interview process is not too bad. They ask your standard interview questions and want you to draw on clinical experience. They also ask personality questions like how do you handle stress. Just be yourself. They can tell if you are genuine or not.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stess?

title: Recruiting Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: Communication with the senior recruiter was difficult due to them stating in email that they would send a formal job description, but did not include an attachment. I replied the following day requesting the attachment, and that it wasn’t included in the initial interview request email. I then got a generic email, that did not have the attachment and did not answer my questions. I later asked again in email for the attachment, and was finally sent the formal job description for review. The interview itself was informal, and was difficult to hear the recruiter over their typing. No matter how many times I explained that I was having a hard time hearing them, there was no change. They also had me provide 3 letters of reference before the interview. Lots of hoops to jump through for a job with no benefits, low pay, and no job security.
Interview Questions: We don’t have the FTE for this role, are you comfortable being PRN (no benefits, no guarantee for hours, higher pay rate)?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Riverview, FL) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: The entire process took about 2 months. You start by filling out the application online and list 3 references. The references will receive an email survey that they have to fill out and submit. Once all the references submit the survey, a recruiter will reach out via email to schedule a screening interview. The screening interview will be by phone call. During the phone interview, the recruiter will ask you basic questions such as “what are your strengths” or “why do you want to work for us”.  They will also explain the position you applied for. If you impress the recruiter, they will get back with you in a few days to set up a second interview in person or by video call. The wait in between interviews was about 3.5 weeks. The second interview will likely be a panel interview. Mine was a total of 5 managers from different units. My interviewer introduced herself and the others, and then went right for the interview questions. At the end she asked if I had any questions and then the interview ended. It was quick, about 15 minutes. After the interview, it took 4 days for the recruiter to call me about the hiring managers decision.
Interview Questions: Why did you become a nurse?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: It was the typical interview format. There were a series of questions and upon completion, I was giving an opportunity to ask them questions. The process was smooth and professional.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for BayCare?

title: Staff RN Nights Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: A  phone interview, interview with unit manager, then group interview with charge nurse and one or two staff members. All interviews were relaxed, informal and low stress. Unit manager very personable and interested in finding staff with teamwork.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses. Give an example of a time you provided exemplary patient care that went above and beyond.

title: Food and Nutrition Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Saint Pete, FL) in Jan 2022

title: Real Estate Associate Interview

Interview Questions: Your experience in the industry

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview

title: Executive Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: I applied online. 2 weeks later I had a phone interview with talent acquisition. I didn't think I performed well but I had a video interview with the "boss". I received a generic decline email about 3 weeks later. The job has since reopened after a very short time.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions with talent acqusition. More casual with the "boss".

title: Healthcare Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Went through three interviews with the company and then never heard back. Imagine being entitled enough to take up three hours of your time and then never follow up with your candidates. Incredibly unprofessional.
Interview Questions: What is your sourcing workflow?

title: RNC Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: Applied position was filled but manager took time to verify if interested in alternative positions.      I appreciated the extra effort from the company even though I wasn't interested.   Thank you.

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted by an  HR recruiter for the position of a software developer. My résumé was submitted to the hiring manager, but was told the job description for the position was completely different than what the position would be doing. Also the HR Recruiter submitted the wrong résumé. 

After that, the hiring manager scheduled additional interviews for the next round, which was a complete waste of time. One member of the team asked all the questions and gave smart remarks throughout the interview and had a very unprofessional stand off attitude. Not just with me but with her fellow team members as well. If that’s how this department operates then I want no parts of working in that type of environment.
Interview Questions: Oracle based questions on sql…..

title: IT Helpdesk Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at BayCare Health System in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interviews showed up on time for the teams meeting and were professional. The interviews consisted one person from HR and a manager you would work under. Seems like a great place to work at.
Interview Questions: Asked alot of technical questions but nothing you wouldn't learn from earning an A+ cert.

title: Associate Counsel Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: This company really cares about finding the right fit for their culture. The interview process is rigorous but I thoroughly enjoyed each step. They will give you the opportunity to meet the entire team both in one one one and small group settings.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to negotiate a contract from start to finish by yourself.

title: Security Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Everyone was very friendly.  After applying, I got a call from HR to discuss the position.  She asked if I could quickly relocate due to the urgency of the position and had me fill out some references which sent out surveys.

2 months later I get a text from the hiring manager asking if we could talk on the phone.  After he rescheduled twice after we got on the phone he asked if we could switch to video call.  The interview was pretty casual.  He never got my resume from HR so I sent it over. He was very kind, but a comment was made about making sure I was dressed properly for further interviews (even though he changed to video last second).

Usually the team interview would be next, but due to vacations I met with the interviewing manager's director.  This was also fairly casual giving me half the time to ask questions.

The team interview also went well.  All very friendly and plenty of time to interview them as well as being interviewed.

Next was an interview with the CTO, but that never happened.   Instead I got a call with an offer.  HR was very nice, but she didn't know much about company benefits or policy.  I had to ask for documentation a couple times to find out that information.  

I declined the offer not only because of the interview process, but concerns with the position and relocating.

After declining the position, the hiring manager very kindly texted/called me a few times to see if we could make something work.  He also was not aware of their retirement package, but was happy to talk through all of my concerns.  It did feel kind of strange that a hiring manager was having these conversations instead of HR.  We clarified things like needing to use your vacation on federal holidays (they have 6 that you must use vacation time, the other 5 federal holidays you are expected to work.), financial concerns, retirement benefits, and concerns with the position.

Ultimately, they couldn't change much else other than salary, so the hiring manager mentioned a process (again, not sure why not HR) that they could request to increase the offer.  When asked if I would accept the offer if the maximum increase was approved, I responded with a 95% chance of a yes, but they wanted 100% immediately and we decided to part ways.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with HR for screening interview.  After about a week had three interviews with peers, directors and VP over the course of about two weeks.   No written or presentation requirements.
Interview Questions: What are adjectives that describe you?  Why should I hire you over other candidates?

title: Social Service Specialist Interview

Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Clearwater, FL) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with recruiter who had minimal information on the role 2-3 weeks after I applied. Manager interview was informal- no prepared questions (despite disclosing that there were multiple interviews that week for the role- this is a red flag for me about dept organization and interview objectivity). Scheduled for 30 minutes, but I was there for over an hour. The interviewer joked at the end of our meeting that she was so caught up on our conversation that they forgot to take notes.  Said they were 'absolutely' putting me through for a meeting with next level manager. After three weeks of silence I was rejected via generic email. No responses to my emails regarding that second interview.
Interview Questions: What is your management style? How do you deal with difficult employees and personality?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with recruiter then in person interview with management. Very organized process with detailed instructions on exactly when and where. title: Office Representative Interview

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Riverview, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with manager and department head. Easy and friendly.  Had to answer typical interview questions about team work, conflict resolution, handling stress, and the typical where do you see yourself in five years.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and met some recruiters at a career fair. Everyone was very nice. The recruiter I spoke with only gave me very limited time to choose a second interview with a manager. Because of my class and work schedule, I was not able to make an interview time within the very select hours. The flexiablity rubbed me the wrong way.
Interview Questions: Experience

title: Case Management Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral interviewing and open ended questions. Don’t forget to smile and show your personality a little!  Always ask questions at the end of the interview, it shows you are interested in the position and are taking the interview seriously.
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult situations?

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone call interview first around 30 minutes to go over qualifications and see if youre fit enough to go in for an interview and then on site interview with unit manager and I had a patient care technician in the room as well.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you had to deal with a difficult patient or family member

title: Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a lot like speed dating. Two dozen candidates were rotated to 7 different tables where sat a nurse manager and usually a preceptor. You had 10 minutes at each table to answer questions and impress. Interview questions were pretty generic
Interview Questions: Why Baycare?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at BayCare Health System in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Easy step by step email process then phone interview. Once phone interview completed then went in for panel interview. Panel included eight team members including the manager. Overall pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: What is a skill that I could be better at?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Clearwater, FL) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Apply online.  20 minute phone call with HR. Email survey sent to at least 5 references. 80 minute phone call with manager.  80 minute panel-style  interview with manager and 6 members of the team. They were all very pleasant the manager was very respectful - taking the time to talk to me afterwards about the company and waking with me all the way to the exit.
Interview Questions: Difference in SQL queries, data normalization, experience with dashboard reporting tools, change management,  past projects completed, solutions to analytical scenarios.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Quite a long process - they go by a 360 model.  HR department was a bit slow with communication.  Team members were very responsive.  Overall a good experience.
Interview Questions: How do you handle criticism?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and well organized. First had a phone interview with the recruiter, than was invited to an on-site interview with management. Interview questions were pretty typical, everyone I met was very kind and welcoming.
Interview Questions: Work history and clinical experience/areas of interest. Why did I want to work for Baycare?

title: Medical Records Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Plant City, FL) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly  and courteous and upbeat answer questions best that i can. Try to be very honest to each question that was ask of me. But over all i like the interview. And i really want to work for the hospital. Because i can benefit to be able to work there
Interview Questions: What is a,situation about a rude and unpolite patient and how did you deal with it

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Augusta, ME) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, then 2 days later heard from recruiter from HR. Then after phone interview moved on after I accepted the hourly wages. Then they passed on my credentials to the hiring managers who were hiring for specialty offices that I sought out. Within a weeks time I received an email for a email with manager, I informed them I was out of state and requested a Skype interview which they welcomed. It was new to me but was very professional although they could see me they stated there Skype wasn't working well so I couldn't see them, kinda of uncomfortable in that aspect.
Interview Questions: Asked about how I handle irate patients and what was the outcome.

title: Home Health RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with recruiter, then in person interview with hiring manager. Very long process. Very simple process. Nothing difficult. Causal conversation with the hiring manager not real interview questions
Interview Questions: What is your strength and weakness

title: Medical Records Coder II (Remote) Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter reached out to me 1st and after emailing my resume never heard back. I sent few email follow ups since i was really interested in this position, my friend that works there also tried reaching out for referral but never heard back. Very disappointed how this recruiter handles application process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Clearwater, FL) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: The first interview at the MLK office went average, but I didnt get hired there. Then the second interview in Clearwater with Brittany was nice, friendly and good conversation with whom I interviewed with. We laughed and had a good time, then i got hired the same day.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at an urgent care?

title: CT Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Clearwater, FL) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Call from manager, very casual interview with an invite to come back for a two hour wishing interview. This was very nice because it gave way to actual processes and to valuable questions I may not have thought of.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background.

title: Onsite Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: the overall interview process was good! I applied online & following day received email asking to set up an interview.  My first phone interview went really well maybe 20 mins long.  about a week later i had second interview asking a few additional questions & later a one on one in person interview
Interview Questions: typical interview questions such as why baycare. none of questions were unexpected

title: HIM Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at BayCare Health System in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Received the Job offer really quickly  very low key. However be  very careful of what is told to you during the interview. Also pay very close attention to the benefits that are offered. and the amount of hours worked during slow seasons
Interview Questions: where do you see your self in the future

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: 1 hour phone interview with the Marketing Manager, 30 minute in-person interview with the Marketing Director, and 1 hour in-person group interview with the Marketing Team. Took about 2 weeks total, very enjoyable experience. Group interview was fun and informative. Everyone was very transparent and honest about the position. I felt comfortable asking questions and talking to everyone throughout the process.
Interview Questions: Tell us how your past job experiences would contribute to this position.

title: Social Service Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was a good experience for me. I applied and received a call within a week. I had a phone interview, and then a face to face with 5 staff members. I was offered the position a day later.
Interview Questions: What is a weakness of yours?

title: Pharmacy Technician CPhT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: It was surprisingly quick at first. I got a phone call and email in two days or so, then I called to set up an interview the following week. After the 1 on 1 interview there was a quick meeting with other team members. The longer part was the wait between the offer and orientation as everyone is forced into going to an orientation at the office in clearwater and that appears to only happen once a month.
Interview Questions: If I knew how to do the job and had the appropriate training

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online.  Contacted via email by HR.  Had phone interview with HR representative.  Then had in person interview with members of the leadership team.  Offered the job same day by phone call.
Interview Questions: Name a strength and a weakness you have.

title: ICU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I received a call from HR to set a 30-60 minute interview with HR via phone.
When they called me they asked me a series of questions related to my work experience, personality, and education. 
Examples:
What is your work experience? 
How long have I been a nurse?
Verify my degrees
What are my certifications?
Etc...
 

After this, the HR recruiter said that I would be a good candidate and he would set me up with an interview with two managers from the main facility. 
I set up a date and time.
When I arrived, I went to the information desk in the front lobby. It was great that the parking was free and convenient. 
A lady from the front desk called them upstairs to tell them I arrived. I was escorted by a greeter to the elevators which was really nice because for sure I would have gotten lost in the maze of the facility. I went up to the designated floor and one of the managers met me at the elevator and escorted me to a classroom. The told me to have a seat and they would go get the other managers. I was interviewed by a panel which included the MICU and ICU manager and a charge nurse from one of the units. 
Afterwards, they gave me a tour of both ICUs and introduced me to staff.
Overall it was very pleasant. Everyone from the front desk up and up was super helpful and kind. the unit itself was clean, organized. They patient rooms of the MICU was spectacular.
Interview Questions: Have I ever been tardy

title: Housekeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: went great! everything was as planned and the professionalism of the interviewer was evident. She was polite and she gave me time to answer all of my questions. I would highly recommend this hospital as everyone is kind there.
Interview Questions: rough situation

title: Anesthesia Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Bartow, FL) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with the recruiter followed by an interview at the hospital. The interviewers made me feel very welcomed which helped with my nervousness. They asked very good questions as did I.
Interview Questions: What made me apply for the position at their institution?

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: The initial process is grueling for a PCT. I've heard other people say that they got a call within a week of putting in an application, I put in around 70. I started getting some calls, got scheduled for a phone interview, then scheduled for a face to face with the hiring manager. One of my other friends who works for the system said if you get the face to face, you pretty much got the job. I received an offer a couple days later and accepted. After the initial call backs, the process was swift. Getting to that point is a waiting game.
Interview Questions: What do you think you can improve on?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Largo, FL) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by in office interview. The recruiter emailed with a date for the phone interview. We chatted for about an hour and she was a wealth of info and went through company openings to make sure I had applied for all relevant positions.
Interview Questions: Experience

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Saint Petersburg, FL) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: short, basic questions. there were 5 people there. only 2 asked questions, the rest stared at me and then i left. lasts 15 minutes if that. intensive references process, email survey sent via email to references
Interview Questions: why do you want this job

title: Master Level Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: I applied and a week later received a call from a supervisor to do a in-person interview. After the in-person interview, the recruiter emailed me re: references and we set up a date to speak.
Interview Questions: How do you encourage someone to change?

title: Medical Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: Confusing. Why do I have to know someone to work here or wait a month to see if I was hired? Horrible most troubling process on how people are treated when they are clearly qualified.
Interview Questions: Fair questions

title: Clinical Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Lutz, FL)
Interview Descriptions: I Applied online through Taleo, passed the initial computer screening , and  got a call from HR for a in person interview. The interview was panel style with 3 hiring managers. I was called back 2 weeks later by HR and had a final phone interview that took about 35 min. Then I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Baycare?

title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: Applied through Job Board, easy to submit. Called by educator to set up first interview, approximately  one week from closure of application. First interview with floors nurse educator assistant and unit charge nurse. They were nice, provided clear description of the program and asked several interview questions. Interview lasted about 30 minutes. Called for second interview about a week later, this is tomorrow. Sorry night shift, all interviews are done during days.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a critical care nurse?

title: Social Service Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at BayCare Health System in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I am currently going through the interview process and came here to get information. I struggled finding anything on this particular position and because of that, I thought it'll be nice of me to share my experience for others applying for the Social Services Specialist I position. 

I originally applied for the position on Monday, March 27, 2017. On Thursday, March 30, 2017, I received an email from a recruiter informing me that she would like to schedule a phone screen as part as the first step in the interview process. 

Today, April 4, 2017, I had my phone screen at 1:30pm. The questions were very basic. She discussed salary and the next steps if I were to be selected to continue. After the "phone interview," she asked if I was comfortable with the salary and informed me that my information would be passed off to the hiring manager. A few hours later, I received an email asking me to submit my references. 

I'm praying and keeping my fingers crossed! I really want this position. 

By the way, I was told the starting salary is $21.00 for my 5 years of experience and having a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology degree (A bachelor's degree in some type of social service field is required for this position) 
They also hire for Social Service Specialist II and I'm sure the pay will be higher. The requirement for that position is to have a Masters degree in some type of social service field (i.e, Psychology, Healthcare Administration, Counseling, and etc.) I graduate this June (2017) with my Masters of Science degree in Counseling, so hopefully I'm offered a position now and able to transition later. *Fingers Crossed*
Interview Questions: Why do you want to leave your current job?

title: Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Saint Petersburg Beach, FL) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Short, panel interview with the charge nurses and the manager of the unit. Asked about prior experience and educational experience and several behavioral questions. The interview was no longer than 30 minutes and came with an offer soon after.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have to be an educator?

title: Emergency Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Riverview, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an application and received an email several days later regarding a phone interview. Had my phone interview and was asked to come in for a f2f. Had the f2f interview, which lasted approximately 30 minutes and went very well in my opinion. Was escorted around the ER and given a tour. Was told that I would be contacted in a week and never heard anything again. I called the manager and inquired about my application and was told that I would be contacted the next day regarding yet another interview. Well, nothing ever happened. Why can't companies send out a do not reply email if you haven't been selected? It's very disrespectful to leave someone waiting for an answer and doesn't give people a good impression of the company.
Interview Questions: What was a scenario that put me in a high stress situation and how did I handle it.

title: Advanced Practice Provider Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Communication between HR and myself was poor. Went through interview process only to learn they had extended offers to other candidates before my interview. Dinner was great but overall my experience was poor.
Interview Questions: What's your story?

title: MHT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Dunedin, FL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: MULTI LEVEL INTERVIEW...Step ONE Application Selection Process (This took 2 weeks).Step Two Recruiter Phone Interview (1)(30 Min Interview). Step Three Site Interview(45 Min Interview). Step Four Recruiter Phone Interview (2)(15 Min Interview).
Interview Questions: If you saw a co-worker yelling at a patient or becoming borderline abusive how would you handle the situation ?

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Riverview, FL) in Jan 2017

Quick and fast. Usual interview questions. Talk about your experience level and how you can improve the cleanliness of hospital. Team player who works hard. 
Always want to give the best ossicle customer service you can. Strive for excellence
Interview Questions: Why do you want here at Baycare?

title: Assistant Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at BayCare Health System in Dec 2016

Interview Questions: Why work there?

title: Lab Assistant IV Interview

The lab manager and supervisor were very nice, and so was the recruiter. Unfortunately, I didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: They gave several scenarios and asked me to rate myself on a scale of 1 to 10

title: Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Clearwater, FL) in Oct 2016

title: MA Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Clearwater, FL) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward. Interview Questions: Worst scenario you have encountered.

title: Director of Ecommerce Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Applied Online.Got an email from HR person-Alison Raab for phone screening. 30 mins call. No email or follow up call. Sent a couple of follow up emails to the HR person requesting status update.No response. 
Here is my 2 cents: Just like you are interviewing the person, the person is interviewing your company too. Its 2 way road. When HR does not respond and let the candidate know of the result(either yay or nay)-it is a reflection on the company and their process and not just that HR person. Courtesy and empathy are two key attributes which obviously this company or the HR lacks.
Interview Questions: Experience

title: Registrar Interview

What is my ideal job duties? 
What is my ideal working environment? 
Give an example of a time where I had to deal with a difficult patient/client.

title: Nurse Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Clearwater, FL) in Mar 2016

After moving forward at the round-up, I received another interview for the unit that I requested and was offered a position.
Interview Questions: A lot of theoretical nursing quesitons were asked in addition to team work questions, prioritization questions, and goals/future outlooks.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Palm Harbor, FL) in Mar 2016

I was told I would hear back - one way or the other - within a few days.  After not hearing for almost 2 weeks, I sent a detailed follow up email; only to receive a stock "regrets" email in response.
Interview Questions: The normal questions were asked; nothing out of the ordinary.

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Clearwater, FL) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I'm not 100% sure the exact date i applied. But it was in February of 2016. I got called for an interview around the end of March. Interview process was so smooth. It was as if we were having a casual conversation over coffee. Not in a bad way, it just wasnt so nerve wracking and uptight and i wasnt petrified to be interviewed.
Interview Questions: What is one thing you feel you have to work on?

title: Customer Service Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the job and it took about a month to get a response. If you know someone that works for baycare see if they can help you speed up the process. Took a month to get an interview in. The next day i was notified I got the job. Right before the interview HR called to reconfirm some questions. After the interview, HR called again to talk salary, benefits etc, and let you know where to report for 1st day orientation at Baycare HQ in clearwater. Then you get your own orientation at your respective location. Ask as many questions as possible. Sometimes the job posting doesnt really entail everything, quite vague.
Interview Questions: Are you planning to continue your education?

title: Clinical Nurse II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Jan 2016

They reviewed my resume with me and asked me the standard interview questions. They obviously wanted me to have questions about the job, instead of just answering their questions.

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview

title: Customer Service Support Specialist Interview

Interview Questions: Describe a time you had a disagreement with a co-work. How did you handle this situation?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Safety Harbor, FL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with the Manager and 3 Coordinators, they were very professionals and thorough in the interviewing process. Each asked me a set of questions based on my experiences and the reason I chose Baycare to work for.
Interview Questions: Why did want to work for Baycare.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Sept 2015

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Computer based application, emailed a manager my resume, got a call from team resources to interview, then had the in person panel interview and then reference review where I had to submit names and email addresses of my professional references then phone interview with team resources
Interview Questions: Describe a typical shift/ how you set up your day

title: Site Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Saint Petersburg, FL) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I first received a call to be set up with a phone screen. The date was set and it came and went with no call. I contacted the person that initially set up the screening and she apologized and reset the date. I then received a phone call to set up an interview. I was also set up with an online site to list my references which I did and all answered back but the next day.I receive another call to change the interview date with the Practice Administrator and a doctor in a different office than what I applied for. 
The day of the interview the Practice Administrator was impressed and also mentioned that she would like me to interview with a different office as well. The doctor that I came back and met with that day told me that my resume was impressive and that she hoped I would consider working for her. At that time the Practice Manager gave me her card and encouraged me to contact her with questions or to check on the status. That afternoon I sent her a thank you email and a question that I had thought of. No return email. 
The next week I received a call and was set up with an interview for the second doctor office. I met with three doctors and was told that the Practice Manager was unable to make it. The interview appeared to go well. I wrote a second thank you to the Practice Manager and a question regarding the second position that I interviewed for. No return email. 
A week went by and I tried to call the Practice Manager and get an update. I left a message with her assistant. About an hour and a half later I received a generic email stating that I was not being considered for the position that I originally applied for and never even interviewed for.
I find the way that I was handled very unprofessional. It's too bad because Bay Care appears to be a great company to work for.
Interview Questions: There really wasn't any difficult or unexpected questions for the position that I was interviewing for.

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Overall the experience was pleasant and atmosphere was not stressful, the interviewer was thorough and was  asking us on how to handle several
Scenarios .. She question us on our eligibilities and reasons why we  are appropiate with this job.  The interview lasted for an hour but seems like we were just having a comversation . The interviewer was knowledgable in her foeld and was able to answer all
Our concerns with the offer
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Chaplain Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Clearwater, FL) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I initially interviewed with one of the CPE Supervisors, after which I interviewed with a group of individuals in the Pastoral Care department. The interview was congenial yet challenging and served as excellent experience for future interviews.
Interview Questions: What was the most difficult feedback that you received during your last unit of CPE?

title: ICU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Winter Haven, FL) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview questions such as why you wanted to become nurse. A tour of the department I was interviewing for along with starting pay, benefits, job role, etc. Also basic body lift dynamics, stretching and drug test were done
Interview Questions: Why did you choose nursing?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Brooksville, FL) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: After initial HR outreach one interview. Done by supervisor and several members of the team.  I was not told that I was going to be interviewed by that many people at once so it was a little unnerving when I walked into meeting room and I sat at one table and 10 other people sat at two other's on either side of me.
Interview Questions: a lot of questions about time management and how you handle workload and documentation.

title: Housekeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (New Port Richey, FL) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: met in persons office, sat down after shaking hands and exchanging greetings and introductions, then they asked about my past experience and what qualified me for the position, I answered that I have been cleaning houses since I was 8 years of age and its basically all I know how to do, cleaning is my life pretty much, its what I am good at and surprisingly it is actually enjoyable to be and its a great stress reliever for me as well.
Interview Questions: what qualified me for the job?

title: Master Level Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for the position. About 1 week later, I received a phone call from a supervisor screening if I enjoyed working with children/families and if I wanted to work in-homes. After that a 1:1 interview was set up. I met with the supervisor and the interview was standard (normal interview questions) and professional. The interview lasted about 1 hour.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a child started attacking a parent?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at BayCare Health System in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, and received a phone call from a Nurse Recruiter a few days later to set up an interview.   I interviewed with a Nurse Recruiter and the Nurse Supervisor for the position/floor I applied for.  I was required to have 5 references that could fill out an online survey,  with two of the references being current or former managers. A couple days later I received a job offer.
Interview Questions: Name something you did to resolve a problem a patient was having?

title: Clinical Nurse II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: face to face with manager, questions and statements regarding culture of the unit applied for and expectations. Future goals of interviewer. Understanding of baycare values. follow up phone call from team resources for job offer.
Interview Questions: Know baycare values and how you use them daily.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at BayCare Health System in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Dont waste your time. After doing a phone interview, which the recruitor called 20 minutes late, this should have been the first bad sign.This company tells you they will have someone call you either way within one week. Here its been three months and I get a rejection email.If a person takes the time to do a phone interview and go through the reference process, they should have common courtesy to keep you informed.
Interview Questions: Scenario questions

title: Sterile Processing Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Standard questions. They want to make sure you are willing to learn something new and can get along with different people. There are some tricky questions, as long as you give examples you are ok.
Interview Questions:
How well do you work in a team? Give us some examples.
Can you work overtime on holidays?

title: Locum Tenens Psychiatrist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at BayCare Health System
Interview Descriptions: Locum company made the contact.Then there were phone interviews with two people after submitting cv and filling out many forms.The senior psychiatrist quit in the middle of the process and the woman who finished was an administrator who was impersonal and not very clinically sophisticated.Then a second mid level administrator spoke to me several times,but after hiring was unavailable to discuss possible improvements in the clinical program.
Interview Questions: They had none for me. I asked them why they had trouble keeping psychiatrists

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview with HR followed by in-person interviews with department managers.  Follow up offer by telephone from HR.  I made sure I thoroughly researched the company and position prior to the interview.  During the interview process, I asked several questions to make sure BayCare and this specific department and position was a good fit for me.  Not only was I being interviewed but I also was interviewing them at the same time.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you're the right candidate for our department?

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Safety Harbor, FL)
Interview Descriptions: The phone interview portion was appropriate and professional.  The one-on-one with the hiring manager was interrupted several times, as she was going through Joint Review at the time of my interview.  It was distracting and chaotic.  There was overwhelming number of people in the room for the final panel-style portion, that did not seem to have a purpose and did not know how to conduct an interview.
Interview Questions: This is the most surprising part.  There were no difficult questions and I still did not get the job.  I believe that this was because the members of the panel did not know how to conduct an interview.

title: Lab Medical Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Clearwater, FL) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: it was great interview. people are were nice. it was group interview with superviers i dont know what else to say about it. just go thru,...........Stop asking me more about it.

title: Chaplain Resident Interview

title: Nurse Interview

Interview Descriptions: This  process had  a  lot of  paperwork and  requirements. Overall the interview was  not  very scary the manager  was to  the  point   with expectations  and  requirements.

title: Medical Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Short, brief, fairly pleasant, not alot of questions were really asked. Brief description of the job. Recruiter was rude, but kept a pleasant tone. Overall interview process was easy and short. There were 2 interviews before an offer was made and the background and drug and reference check.

title: Registered Nurse Interview

Interview Questions: why do you want to work here

title: Nurse Interview

Interview Descriptions: I was called by a recruitor who set up a phone interview for following week. I have left 2 voicemail messages with no return call.
Interview Questions: What bothers you about co workers and what would you do

title: RN Professional Role Interview

Interview Questions: What would be your dream job if not this one

That interview appeared to be normal until the last question. No answer provided was acceptable. The same question was asked four times. Then the interview ended abruptly. See question below.

title: Intern Interview

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview

Interview Descriptions: Extremely long and grueling interview process. I had 3 separate interviews where they rapid fire questions and scenarios. It was very intimidating. Lots of questions starting with "Tell me about a time that you did this..." or "Tell me when you have been put in this situation and what you did to resolve it..."
Interview Questions: What would you say to your boss if you didn't agree with their way of doing something?

title: Social Media Coordinator Interview

Interview Descriptions: Following the online application, I received a phone call from a recruiter. After that, I had a phone interview with the hiring manager. After that, I was asked to come in for a 1-1 interview with the hiring manager. And then I was asked to come in again for a larger interview with about 10 different people.
Interview Questions: I don't recall there being a particular question that surprised me.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: My interview with BayCare was over 5 years ago.  The process was professional and the interviewers were proficient when describing the company, benefits, policies and procedures.  The questions asked were typical for a registered nurse.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Dunedin, FL) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview that was very easy. They ask very general questions and are very nice. Then there is an in person interview with a panel of interviewers. They were not very friendly and asked a lot of questions off of a sheet of paper. They asked questions that I didn't have answers for because I had never worked as a nurse before. I thought that was strange. Although the interview didn't seem to go well I got the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you didn't like how management did things and what did you do about it?

title: Medical Coder Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Quick HR initial interview and turnaround time for interview with management was fairly quick. Interview was with hiring manager as well as other managers in order to have a panel interview. Questions focused on experience and team work as well as career goals. I was able to ask questions in turn about the management style, work assignment, opportunities for advancement, and other benefits such as the ability to work from home.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Copywriter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Clearwater, FL) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I got a call from a BayCare in-house recruiter, who interviewed me and scheduled me for an in-person interview. At the in-person interview, there were three people present: Creative Director, Art Director, and Sr. Copywriter. It was a laid back, casual interview, which accurately reflects the work environment. These folks are as they appear: no phony corporate shills here. This is good because if you respond well in the interview, then you probably will like working for/with them.

One thing later in the process was how long it took the company to process my background check. I was unemployed, so waiting extra weeks for red tape was a financial struggle. It finally cleared, needless to say.
Interview Questions: Be prepared to copy edit a handout.

title: Systems Marketing Manager Interview

Interview Questions: N/A

title: Lab Medical Assistant III Interview

title: Marketing Interview

title: Pst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Lutz, FL) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: it was long and very good they only hire the best. the interviewer was very nice and professional. They made me feel good and positive.they asked very good question and when i asked questin they answer them very good

title: Intern Interview

title: Ultrasound Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Tampa, FL) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions:
HR is very slow to respond to applicants. You have to follow up and be persistent. 
They seem to have a lot of control and little accountability when it comes to responding in a reasonable time frame. Even as a current employee they ignore application request and take weeks to reject or accept.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Safety Harbor, FL) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Called for interview the following day. Went to HR interview, told to interview the following week with office manager. Went to that interview and was told to come back next week to interview with the physicians. Went to that interview and was told that they would call me at the end of the week with the final decision. Was called at the end of the week and asked to come in next week for another interview with office staff, went to that interview and was told they would know in a few days and call me. Never heard back. I called and spoke to manager who said they would call me by the end of the following week. Still heard nothing. Left voice mail, nothing. Finally sent email, and got a response saying they were sorry for not getting back to me but they went with someone else.
Interview Questions: I was asked to come in and sit down with all of the other employees, who asked me personal questions about if I had kids and so on.

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: RN Interview

I had to go through drug testing, background & criminal check. Pass a physical.

title: Clinical Pharmacist Interview

title: IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Clearwater, FL) in Jul 2010

Asked about what their 5 core qualities meant to me, they were up on the wall in posters, they were trust, respect, and a 3 others I cant remember.  Stated they were going make a decision in 1-2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Tell me what trust means to you.

title: Health Care Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at BayCare Health System (Clearwater, FL) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online to position listed on web site, and was called for telephone interview by recruiter.  This was followed by a personal interview held with two program managers.  Thoughtful dialogue ensued and I responded to questions with solid, practical answers.  I also followed up on the intervew by sending additional information that would be useful for program consideration.  

At the end of the process, it seemed that the program directors were not sure what they wanted in a candidate, or where to take the program.  They continue to consider these factors and the position is still advertised.
Interview Questions: What have you done in that prepares you for this position?

title: MRI Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at BayCare Health System in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was seamless and pleasant.
